edu.biu.protocols.yao.offlineOnline.subroutines

Class OnlineComputeRoutine

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.protocols.yao.offlineOnline.subroutines.OnlineComputeRoutine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComputeCircuitsRoutine

    public class OnlineComputeRoutine
extends java.lang.Object
implements ComputeCircuitsRoutine
    This class computes the circuits and returns the output. It also achieves the proof of cheating in case not all the circuits output the same result.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Asaf Cohen)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  OnlineComputeRoutine.ComputeThread
      Inner thread class that compute the circuits in a separate thread.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OnlineComputeRoutine

        public OnlineComputeRoutine(FastGarbledBooleanCircuit[] garbledCircuits,
                            CryptoPrimitives primitives,
                            byte[][][][] proofCiphers,
                            javax.crypto.SecretKey hashedProof)
        A constructor that sets the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        garbledCircuits - The circuits to work on. There is one circuit per thread.
        primitives - Primitives objects to use in the compute step.
        enc - Used to extract the proof of cheating.
        proofCiphers - Used to extract the proof of cheating.
        hashedProof - Used to extract the proof of cheating.

    • Method Detail

      • computeCircuits

        public void computeCircuits()
        Description copied from interface: ComputeCircuitsRoutine
        Computes the inline circuits.
        Specified by:
        computeCircuits in interface ComputeCircuitsRoutine

      • runOutputAnalysis

        public CircuitEvaluationResult runOutputAnalysis()
        Description copied from interface: ComputeCircuitsRoutine
        After evaluating the circuits, an output analysis should be executed in order to detect cheating. In case of cheating, a proof of the cheating is achieved and saved in the derived object.
        Specified by:
        runOutputAnalysis in interface ComputeCircuitsRoutine
        Returns:
        CircuitEvaluationResult Contains one of the folowing three posibilities: 1. VALID_OUTPUT 2. INVALID_WIRE_FOUND 3. FOUND_PROOF_OF_CHEATING.

      • getOutput

        public byte[] getOutput()
        Description copied from interface: ComputeCircuitsRoutine
        Returns the output of the circuits.
        Specified by:
        getOutput in interface ComputeCircuitsRoutine

      • setCorrectCircuit

        public void setCorrectCircuit(int j)

      • getProofOfCheating

        public javax.crypto.SecretKey getProofOfCheating()
        Returns the proof of cheating. In case there was no cheating, returns a dummy secret key.

      • getComputedOutputWires

        public byte[] getComputedOutputWires(int circuitIndex)
